overview_of_class: This class will introduce you to the logic of statistical reasoning and its application to quantitative social sciences, equipping you with the tools to draw conclusions about populations from sample data. We will cover descriptive statistics, probability, random variables, sampling distributions, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, and regression.
name: Introductory Statistics for the Social Sciences
title: WCAS STAT 210-0-20 Introductory Statistics for the Social Sciences

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will introduce you to the logic of statistical reasoning and its application to quantitative social sciences, equipping you with the tools to draw conclusions about populations from sample data. We will cover descriptive statistics, probability, random variables, sampling distributions, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, and regression.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: We will meet in lecture three times a week which will include lecturing, discussion and working in small groups; we will meet in discussion section once a week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Your grade will be based on problem sets, two in-class midterm exams, and a final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Statistics for Business and Economics 8ed by Paul Newbold, William Carlson, Betty Thorne. Alternatively, Statistics for Business and Economics Custom Edition for NU, which includes the first 11 chapters from the 8ed. ISBN-13 978-1-256-86179-9.
